writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
Sunlight peeked through the curtains, casting a warm glow over the room. Will Solace groaned dramatically, flopping back onto the pillows like a defeated hero. "Morning already?" he mumbled, rubbing his eyes and turning towards the tangle of dark hair beside him. 

Nico di Angelo, looking like a disgruntled hedgehog, stirred slightly, his face half-buried in the pillow. "Your hair looks like Medusa had a bad day," Will teased, a grin spreading across his face. 

Nico cracked an eye open, a smirk playing at the corners of his lips. "And your breath could scare a hellhound," he shot back, the familiar banter beginning to chase away the last remnants of sleep.

Will leaned over, ignoring the jibe, and planted a kiss on Nico's forehead, feeling the warmth and comfort of the morning settle around them. Their mornings were always like this—filled with laughter, gentle teasing, and the occasional wrestling match to see who would brave the cold floor first.

Nico stretched, cat-like, and sighed contentedly. "You know," he began, his voice still thick with sleep, "I've been thinking."

Will blinked, feigning mock horror. "Thinking? At this hour? Nico, you know we have a strict no-thinking-before-coffee policy."

Nico chuckled, shifting closer. "I was thinking we should shake up our morning routine."

Will raised an eyebrow, intrigued. "What do you have in mind? Let me guess—getting out of bed without a fight?"

"Better," Nico replied, eyes gleaming with mischief. "A morning dance-off."

Will stared at him, his mind processing the suggestion. "You want me to dance before coffee? Are you trying to kill me?"

Nico laughed, a sound that always warmed Will's heart. "Oh come on, it'll be fun! We can start every morning with a dance-off, like one of those TikTok challenges."

Will groaned, but he couldn't help the smile tugging at his lips. "This is madness," he muttered, but deep down, he knew that perhaps madness was exactly what they needed. "Alright, alright. But you're going to have to show me the moves, Mr. Di Angelo."

Nico sat up, his excitement contagious. "It's settled then. Tomorrow morning, we dance."

The next day, the sun rose, and with it, the promise of something new. Will awoke to the sound of music—a catchy tune Nico had found online. He looked over to see Nico already standing, an eager grin on his face.

"Ready to bust a move, Solace?" Nico challenged, extending a hand.

Will hesitated, then laughed, taking Nico's hand and letting himself be pulled to his feet. "Alright, let's do this."

What followed was a chaotic, hilarious attempt at dancing—Will's limbs flailed, Nico's graceful movements contrasting with his own awkward ones. They laughed, tripping over each other, the world outside forgotten in their shared joy.

The dance-off became a staple of their mornings, a new tradition that brought them closer, filling the room with laughter and warmth. They found themselves looking forward to it, eager to start each day with smiles and stolen kisses amidst the playful chaos.

Will realized that sometimes, all it took was a little madness to make life brighter. Nico's unexpected suggestion had changed their mornings forever, adding a touch of magic to the mundane.

And as they collapsed back onto the bed, breathless and grinning, Will knew that these were the moments he cherished most—moments that reminded him why he fell in love with Nico in the first place.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
The late afternoon sun was casting its golden glow through the curtains, warming the living room in a way that made everything feel soft and serene. Nico was sprawled on the couch, half-heartedly scrolling through his own phone when Will, casually munching on an apple, tossed his phone onto the couch beside Nico.

"You know you can look through it anytime, right?" Will said, a playful grin tugging at his lips. Nico raised an eyebrow, intrigued. 

"Is that a challenge, Solace?" Nico teased, setting his phone down and picking up Will’s. The screen was already unlocked, and Nico’s curiosity piqued. He couldn't resist the opportunity to dig a little deeper into Will’s world.

As he swiped through the apps, he hesitated at the photo gallery icon, glancing up to find Will watching him with an amused expression. "What are you hiding in here?" Nico asked with mock suspicion.

"Only the evidence of your secret life as a superhero," Will replied, his eyes twinkling. Nico chuckled and tapped on the gallery.

The photos loaded, and Nico was greeted with a gallery of candid shots. At first, they seemed ordinary—pictures of their friends, snapshots from their adventures—but as he scrolled, he noticed a pattern. There he was, in each photo, often oblivious to the camera.

There was one of him sitting on the porch, book in hand, the setting sun painting the sky in hues of pink and orange. Nico laughed, crinkling his eyes at the memory. "I can't believe you captured my 'thinking face'—it's a rare sight!" he exclaimed.

"You caught me in my natural habitat!" he added, voice dripping with sarcasm. Will chuckled from the kitchen, setting his apple down and walking over to sit beside Nico.

"That one’s my favorite," Will said, pointing to a photo of Nico holding a steaming cup of coffee, a soft smile on his lips as he gazed out the window. "I never realized how much joy a simple cup of coffee could bring until I saw it through your eyes," Nico mused, his voice softer now, introspective.

"I knew you were up to something with all those sneaky smiles!" Nico declared dramatically, feigning shock. Will laughed, nudging him playfully.

"You have a 'serious face' in this one," Will pointed out, teasingly prodding at a picture of Nico intensely focused on a board game. "You look like you’re plotting world domination."

Nico leaned back, letting out a theatrical sigh. "I never knew you saw me like this. I never knew these moments mattered so much," he said, a touch of wonder in his voice.

Will gently brushed a stray hair from Nico’s face, a small, affectionate gesture that spoke volumes. "I see you, Nico. Every day. These moments—they’re special because you’re in them."

Nico felt a warmth spread through him, not just from the sun but from the depth of Will’s words. It was like discovering a behind-the-scenes Instagram story of their life, capturing the essence of everything they shared.

"You’re a secret paparazzo," Nico accused, a smile tugging at his lips. They both laughed, the sound filling the room with an easy, intimate joy.

The world outside continued to glow with the fading light, but inside, Nico felt a different kind of light—a shared warmth, a connection that needed no words. He leaned his head against Will’s shoulder, feeling at home in every sense of the word.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
The sun dipped low over Camp Half-Blood, casting long shadows that danced like mischievous sprites across the training grounds. Nico di Angelo stood with his arms crossed, trying to look stern, but the corners of his mouth twitched upward as Will Solace, the camp’s resident makeup maestro, launched into his latest scheme.

“Come on, it'll be fun!” Will chirped, brandishing a palette of eye shadows with colors so vivid they could rival a peacock. “You can be my canvas, and I'll make you a masterpiece—or at least a meme.”

Nico sighed dramatically, though a smile tugged at his lips. “I didn't sign up to become a walking art exhibit, Will.”

Will laughed, leaning in to press a quick kiss to Nico’s cheek. “You always said you wanted to try something new. Well, here it is!”

Nico rolled his eyes but relented, plopping down onto a stool with exaggerated reluctance. “Fine, but if I end up looking like a disco ball had a baby with a clown, I’m blaming you.”

Will’s eyes sparkled with mischief as he set to work, brushes flying like tiny wands casting spells of color and light. Nico sat still, his mind a whirl of thoughts. I can’t believe I let him do this. But his smile… it’s worth it, right? Or am I just a fool in glitter?

As Will layered on the colors, he kept up a running commentary, teasing and joking in a way that made Nico's heart warm. “This is going viral faster than a cat video on TikTok,” Will declared as he added the final touches, a shimmer that caught the light like a kaleidoscope.

Finally, Will stepped back, a triumphant grin on his face. “And voilà! A masterpiece!”

Nico opened his eyes and stared at his reflection, his jaw dropping. “I can’t believe you turned me into a rainbow warrior!” he exclaimed, trying not to laugh.

The room erupted in laughter as Nico struck a pose, his face a canvas of chaos and color. The dramatic gasp he let out was pure theatrics. “I look like a demigod gone rogue! I could give Dionysus a run for his money!”

Will doubled over in laughter, wiping tears from his eyes. “You’re perfect, Nico. Absolutely perfect.”

Nico turned to face Will, his initial confusion melting away in the face of Will’s infectious joy. “Okay, okay, I admit it. You got me. But only because you look so happy.”

He adjusted his new look in the mirror with a resigned smile. Maybe this isn’t so bad after all. Maybe it’s kind of amazing. 

As they both settled into the comfortable banter that came so easily to them, Nico felt the weight of the day’s worries lift. In Will’s laughter and light, he found his own peace.

“Next time, I’m doing your makeup,” Nico declared with mock seriousness, a playful glint in his eyes.

Will grinned, slinging an arm around Nico’s shoulder. “Deal. But only if I get to be a sunburst of glitter.”

Together, they watched the sunset, the sky painted in hues that mirrored Nico’s new look. And in that moment, surrounded by laughter and love, everything felt just right.
